Comments_List: Going into this course I only had a basic understanding of the ISM and now after taking this course I feel I have a fairly good understanding of all the different process and components in the ISM. I also learned a lot about using radio data which I had never worked with before.
HII region, basic of star formation, radio astronomy
The different phases and emission/heating/cooling processes therein.

I liked that we were able to use real observations in some of our homework assignments and they really helped me learn how to apply concepts we learned in class to real world observations. I also liked the weekly paper reviews because they were often related to topics we discussed that week in lecture so it helped to be able to learn those concepts in class but then learn how they have been applied to current research in the field.

Strength- covers various facets of the ISM.

Weakness- Should include the quantum mechanics of transitions in more detail.

Overall I think the course is well designed and covered all the necessary skills needed to do star formation. Radio astronomy part and handling of data might be difficult for the first-timers. My suggestion is to give them suggested reading and resources to prepare them before asking them to do the data questions in the homework.
Yes this course provides an excellent foundation for understanding the ISM
Yes, I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is interested in doing star/planet formation.
